Articles.Content: Small and possibly meaningless note: in RasterPropMonitor/Library/Props/IndicatorPanelReplacement/prop.cfg, there's a missing closing brace }.

Here's a new problem: out of the blue, tonight, after working just fine last night and every night before, raster prop monitor computer stopped acknowledging the existence of the system resource variables. This, of course, had wide-ranging and devastating effects. The issue persisted with nothing but RPM, ASET, Squad, module manager, and my configs loaded.

Output\_log.txt:

[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VFZhtaia3qfWYXRIm1TMsuaXggcow875/view?usp=drivesdk](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VFZhtaia3qfWYXRIm1TMsuaXggcow875/view?usp=drivesdk)

> 
> 
> On 1/22/2018 at 6:53 AM, JPNB said:
> 
> 
> Hi, I'm having a little bug. On **orbital** and **map** view the **vessel** icon and **target vessel <u>icon</u>**<u> disappeared</u> and I can't find a way to fix it. It worked and then suddenly was gone. I tried reinstalling RPM and Alcor but no result.. Can someone please help me. **Thank you**.
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Edit: It doesn't show any icons actually. Ascend and Descent etc aren't displayed as well.
> 

Any solutions to this? I'm having a similar problem. The icons for the vessels (I.E. space station symbol/probe symbols) in the graphical orbit mode are extremely small. I have to zoom in just to see them (and at that they are low resolution).

![02e73f0455a9d0eb8b14ee2b14a7c8c9.png](https://gyazo.com/02e73f0455a9d0eb8b14ee2b14a7c8c9.png)

No, i'm not using <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> for this mod (although the <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> version has the exact same problem anyways)

This only happens on the MK1 Command pod and MK1 Lander Can. If I use the MK1-2 plugin by ASET, the orbits are correctly displayed for that one.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-06T23:15:40Z" title="03/06/2018 11:15  PM" data-short="6 yr">March 6, 2018</time> by /not/pol/**

MOARdV is making an RPM replacement mod called Avionic Systems, which is not yet feature complete. But he's also kept RPM up to date, and on the MAS github, he says he is going to take some time off of KSP modding until the new forum Terms of Service are more clearly explained.

[https://github.com/MOARdV/AvionicsSystems/wiki/KSP-Forum-ToS](https://github.com/MOARdV/AvionicsSystems/wiki/KSP-Forum-ToS)

So what we have may be all we get for a while.

The ToS of the forum are different from the software EULA.  I think the only question about modding was ambiguity about whether "the Software" included part tools.  And the 1.4 EULA has some specific language about what constitutes the software, so I suspect the modding concerns are moot.  Privacy and user created derivative art posted to the forums are still shakey, but they were anyway.

> 
> 
> Just now, TiktaalikDreaming said:

And the 1.4 EULA has some specific language about what constitutes the software, so I suspect the modding concerns are moot.  **Privacy and user created derivative art posted to the forums are still shakey, but they were anyway.**

Thats why everyone is worried. They need to clear it up for the forums instead of applying a blanket ToS That has a wide range of uses.

The RPM GitHub documentation was just now updated for 1.4.1 (I was refreshing the page desperately XD), but the release wasn't out when I checked.

Can [@Krewmember](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144837-krewmember/)'s project for a RPM style simpit monitor be done using your library and [@zitronen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/11842-zitronen/)'s two way Arduino communication plug-in? Just curious since it would simplify and accelerate his project which would be incredibly useful for simpit builders.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-03-14T22:15:06Z" title="03/14/2018 10:15  PM" data-short="6 yr">March 14, 2018</time> by KerBlitz Kerman**
  
Citing person with link/mention

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, KerBlitz Kerman said:
> 
> 
> Can [@Krewmember](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/144837-krewmember/)'s project for a RPM style simpit monitor be done using your library and [@zitronen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/11842-zitronen/)'s two way Arduino communication plug-in? Just curious since it would simplify and accelerate his project which would be incredibly useful for simpit builders.
> 

I would guess the answer is "no".  RPM by itself is strictly an IVA enhancement mod.  It's not designed to function outside IVA, and it doesn't expose a lot of functionality to outside mods.  That doesn't mean someone can't use it as a basis for an interface with external code.  It's a permissive license.

**RasterPropMonitor v0.30.0** for KSP 1.4.x is now available on GitHub.  This is essentially a "recompiled for KSP" release with a couple of features added in (that I still need to document, natch).  It has been minimally tested, since I've been busy the last couple of weeks.
